thread.title: Four Leicester fans ‘arrested for assaulting police’ during and after Seville clash
thread.title_full: Four Leicester fans ‘arrested for assaulting police’ during and after Seville clash

author: smorgan
title: Four Leicester fans ‘arrested for assaulting police’ during and after Seville clash
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments FOUR Leicester fans have been arrested following clashes during and after the Foxes’ 2-1 defeat in Seville last night, according to reports. 
Spanish website AS claim cops detained the supporters for “attacking and injuring police” in the Spanish city. Getty Images 2 Leicester fans during the game last night 
A video posted online last night appeared to show police charging at Leicester fans after they refused to move off a street. 
The story emerges as another clip showed joyous Leicester fans serenading an old woman as she danced ahead of the game. 
AS claim that one of the fans involved was arrested inside the Ramon Sanchez Pizjuan stadium. 
The other three were arrested outside the ground “after assaulting police who were acting as match security”. Leicester City fans sing and dance with granny before Champions League tie at Sevilla Related stories EUROPA DRAW Manchester United await their fate for Europa League last 16 draw - Schalke, Ajax, Roma in the hat Europa League round-up Lyon thrash AZ Alkmaar 7-1 while a Pope-inspired Villarreal beat Roma 1-0... but lose on agg in the hat When is the Europa League last 16 draw? Man Utd are the only English team left - all you need to know Brand new striker Eric has a shock in store for Nick over the latest blackmail scandal NEIL CUSTIS Wayne Rooney may have turned down China move but his Man United days are numbered... and the statement told you something was up Willy or won't he? Willy Caballero insists he will not rush new Manchester City deal despite being club's No1 keeper STAN-D AND DELIVER Time is sadly running out to organise a salute to Queens Park Rangers legend and Alzheimer's sufferer Stan Bowles 'We were stupid' Christian Eriksen blasts Spurs' display against Gent despite Mauricio Pochettino saying he's 'proud' Bon appetit Man City and Chelsea on red alert after £50m-rated Leonardo Bonucci falls out with Juventus boss Max Allegri SNARLING FOXES Sacked Leicester boss Claudio Ranieri is furious after being 'betrayed by players and board' Neil Ashton Leicester flops who cost Claudio Ranieri his job deserve to lose their Prem title medals LUIZ IS STILL IN KNEE-D David Luiz needs treatment for rest of season following Sergio Aguero horror tackle in November 
The website says the detainees remain under police control pending their release, which could happen today. 
It is claimed that the security detail established for the game included 372 members of the National Police Corps, divided into four separate units. 
Local police officers were also used to maintain calm and to regulate traffic and access to the ground, according to the report. 
One Sevilla fan told the Leicester Mercury how he witnessed clashes between the Foxes' faithful and police. Getty Images 2 Leicester fans appeared in good spirits during their Champions League last-16 clash 
Angel Aramburu said: "I went to my balcony and saw a lot of Leicester supporters in the middle of the street disturbing traffic. 
"A lot of police arrived and stayed in their vans waiting for the supporters to leave the street but they didn't. 
"The police groups started to walk slowly to dissolve them and that's when supporters started to run and crash bottles."
